titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) personal papers, DNA, Series G
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, DNA, Series G FA342
titlestmt.author: John LeGloahec

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-01 00:58:12 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, DNA, Series G

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Material in the Rockefeller family collections that provides the names, correspondence, or activities of living members of the Rockefeller family, and/or documents the net wealth of any Rockefeller family members, is restricted. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: This series is divided into three subseries: Subseries 1 - Notebooks Subseries 2 - Files for the 1968 Campaign Subseries 3 - Files for Other Campaigns and Issues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Although the acronym DNA may have stood for Definitive News Analysis, no corroboration has been found in the written record. The staff of DNA were on Rockefeller's personal payroll.

There were two main divisions to DNA, a research group for Nelson Rockefeller. The Domestic Policy staff was overseen by Roswell B. Perkins, while the Foreign Policy Staff was led by Henry Kissinger. In later years, DNA was headed by Oscar M. Ruebhausen. The main function of the organization was to draft position papers and research reports on issues important to the Governor's pursuit of the Republican presidential nomination.
NOTE TO RESEARCHERS

This series contains the office files of several members of Nelson A. Rockefeller's staff. These files document official activities in the execution of their duties as members of Rockefeller's staff. The actions, decisions, and exchanges of information or points of view documented here occurred in the course of proposing and implementing policies for the Rockefeller administration, political campaigns, and/or Rockefeller's personal activities. However, unless a document is specifically addressed to or from Nelson A. Rockefeller, or is referred to in a document addressed to him, it should not be assumed he saw the document or was aware of its existence or substance. Furthermore, researchers should bear in mind that staff files may contain documents or drafts addressed to Rockefeller which were never shown to him.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: Researchers may want to review other materials that may relate to this series that can be found in Record Group 15, Series 17: Issue Books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: These notebooks (originally in large black binders that have been discarded) contain position papers, press releases, memoranda, and correspondence on issues during the 1968 Presidential campaign. Both foreign and domestic policy issues are represented here. This subseries contains opposition research on the 1968 Republican presidential nominee, Richard Nixon. There are also information on issue positions for other candidates in 1968, including Hubert Humphrey, Ronald Reagan, and Robert Kennedy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 1 Arms Control - background paper. Tab 2 "Building a Just World Order" - press release, May 1, 1968. Tab 3 Burns Letter - "My Concept of the Presidency," prepared for "Life" magazine [correspondence from NAR to James MacGregor Burns on article Burns is writing for the magazine]. Tab 4-6 China, Mainland - position paper; questions and answers; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP. Tab 7-9 Commitments, United States - press release, June 12, 1968; outline of press release, June 7, 1968; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP. Tab 10-12 Cuba - press release, August 2, 1958; draft statement on Cuba by Nancy Maginnes and Peter Rodman; background memo to Richard Aldrich from Stuart Morrison. Tab 13-20 Defense - recommended positions; questions and answers; Background papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 21-25 Defense - recommended positions; questions and answers; Background papers. Tab 26-31 Eastern Europe - fact sheets; positions comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP, position papers; background papers; press releases, Czechoslovakia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 1-5 Economic Policy - press releases; draft statements; fact sheets. Tab 6-8 Foreign Aid - fact sheets; question and answers; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP. Tab 9-11 Germany - press release; fact sheets. Tab 12 Japan - fact sheets. Tab 13 [Robert] Kennedy Assassination - meeting notes with John Gardner, Caryl Haskins, Henry Kissinger. Tab 14-15 Latin America - press release, questions and answers; draft speech; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 16-17 Latin America - press release, questions and answers; draft speech; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP. Tab 18-20 Middle East - fact sheets; questions and answers; draft speech; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP. Tab 21-24 National Science Policy - press release, draft speech; views of Richard Morse, July 11, 1968; background paper. Tab 25-29 National Security - press release; draft speech; background papers, position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 1-5 Non-Proliferation Treaty - press release; draft speech; questions and answers; background paper; Kissinger memo to NAR, June 8, 1968. Tab 6-7 Pueblo - background paper; questions and answers. Tab 8-11 Republican Platform - "Where Are We Now in the Campaign," June 9, 1968; outline of suggestions for the Republican Platform, June 30, 1968; complete text of 1968 Republican Platform; press release, NAR acceptance of platform. Tab 12-13 Rensselaer Commencement - draft of address to Rensselaer Commencement, May 20, 1968; outline of remarks. Tab 14 Southeast Asia - fact sheets. Tab 15 United Nations - fact sheets; questions and answers; background papers; draft speeches; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP; press releases.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tab 16-23 United Nations - fact sheets; questions and answers; background papers; draft speeches; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP; press releases. Tab 24-31 U.S.S.R. - fact sheets; questions and answers; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP; press releases.

scopecontent.p: Tab 1-11 Western Europe and NATO - fact sheets; questions and answers; position comparisons, NAR, Nixon, GOP; press releases; draft speech; background papers.

Stone's Weekly" on Rockefeller's Record as a Hawk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This material comprises supplementary documentation for the notebooks found in subseries 1. Boxes 17 to 21 of this subseries contain the original documents used for the notebooks that were disseminated among Governor Rockefeller's staff. Also noteworthy are the fact sheet files for each state visited by Governor Rockefeller, which contain pertinent information on the state. The majority of the material is correspondence and chronological files created during the running of a national campaign. Finally, there are also the organizational files for the DNA group.

did.unittitle: Files for Other Campaigns and Issues

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries is a conglomerate of files created during Rockefeller's other campaigns. Rockefeller's run for the governorship in 1958 and his early plans for a presidential candidacy in 1960 are among the contents. There are also files pertaining to New York state and city politics, including an examination of the 1961 New York City mayoral campaign.
